{{also|做东}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=做东}}

===Etymology===
* In ancient China, houses were oriented north and south. The host usually seats on the east side while the the guest seats at the western side.

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=zuòdōng
|c=zou6 dung1
|mn=qz,tp,xm:chòe-tong/kh,zz:chò-tong/twv:choh-tong
|cat=v
}}

===Verb===
{{zh-verb}}

# to be [[host]], to [[host]] somebody
#: {{zh-x|今天 我 '''做東'''，明天 輪到 你 了！|Today, I'll '''invite''' you to dinner and tomorrow it'll be your turn!}}
#: {{zh-x|今晚 我 '''做東'''。|It is '''my treat''' tonight.}}
